TextView.android:text: In Python, operators are special symbols that perform arithmetic and logical computation. The value operated by the operator is called the operand.
5 + 6 = 11. In this example, 5 and 6 are called operands and the + is called operator.
Python language supports the following types of operators.
The arithmetic operators are used to mathematical operation, such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, exponentiation, and modulus operations.
Subtract right operand from the left
Divide left operand by the right one (always results into float)
Divides left hand operand by right hand operand and returns remainder
division that results into whole number adjusted to the left in the number line
Comparison operators are used to compare values. It returns either TRUE or FALSE according to the condition.
Return TRUE if both operands are equal
Return TRUE if operands are not equal
Return TRUE if left operand is greater than the right operand
Return TRUE if left operand is less than the right operand
Return TRUE if left operand is greater than or equal to the right
Return TRUE if left operand is less than or equal to the right
Assignment operators are used in Python to assign values to variables.
Logical operators are the AND, OR, NOT operators.
True if both the operands are true
True if either of the operands is true
Bitwise operators are used to compare binary numbers.
Sets each bit to 1 if both bits are 1
Sets each bit to 1 if one of two bits is 1
Sets each bit to 1 if only one of two bits is 1
Shift left by pushing zeros in from the right and let the leftmost bits fall off
Shift right by pushing copies of the leftmost bit in from the left, and let the rightmost bits fall off
Membership Operators are used to test whether a value is presented in a sequence such as strings, lists, sets, tuples, and dictionaries.
Return TRUE if present in a sequence
Return TRUE if not present in a sequence
Identity Operators are used to compare the objects on the same memory location.
Returns True if both variables are the same object
Returns True if both variables are not the same object
